DOC.detailed_description: Purpose : evaluate neuroprotective effect Copaxone ( Glatiramer acetate ) injection nerve fiber layer thickness retinal function diabetic patient underwent panretinal photocoagulation ( PRP ) . Study Design : Double- Masked Randomized Clinical Trial . The follow period estimate 12 month last PRP section . Patients enrollment : Thirty patient severe nonproliferative early proliferative diabetic retinopathy previous laser treatment enrol . They divide two group : `` A '' receive Copaxone `` B '' receive mannitol ( placebo ) use block randomization . Both drug offer subcutaneous administration one week prior three section PRP , one per week . All patient receive signed write inform consent approve research ethic committee UNIFESP . Chronogram : All patient receive full ophthalmic examination ( best-corrected Log-Mar visual acuity , slit lamp examination , applanation tonometry , fundus biomicroscopy indirect fundus examination ) ; functional examination ( Humphrey 24-2 SITA STANDARD visual field , Electroretingrams FDT C-20 strategy visual field ) anatomic examination ( Color digital photography fluorescein angiography ( FAG ) , GDX- VCC , Optical Coherence Tomography ( OCT ) Heidelberg Retinal Tomography ( HRT ) PRP 1st,3rd,6th month 1 year laser , whenever need clinical reason .
DOC.criteria: Sex : Males female ; Females must postmenopausal 6 month must negative pregnancy test ( serum βHCG ) prior study entry Age : 18 70 year old Type 1 2 diabetes , assign panretinal photocoagulation Vision acuity 20/100 good SE ±6,00 DE Volunteer must willing able sign inform consent Volunteer must ambulatory require skilled nursing care Normal skin appearance area inject ( tattoo , scar , birth mark etc . ) Eye Related : Dense cataract vitreous opacity Other retinal disease diabetic retinopathy Glaucoma ( IOP high 21 mmHg Cup disk ratio equal high 0.8 ) optic nerve diseases Other eye threaten systemic disease No ocular surgery last 6 month include laser treatment No previous retinal photocoagulation cryopexy kind Systemic exclusion criterion : Known immunological condition/disease No active infection within 30 day prior enrollment ( e.g . urinary tract infection , upper/lower respiratory tract infection , skin infection , arthritis etc . ) Use interferon , immunosuppressive therapy , cytotoxic , corticosteroid , chemotherapy lymphoid irradiation within 1 year prior study entry .
